name: iron ore mine operation and beneficiation | iron ore concentrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10588/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of iron concentrate containing 66.15% of Fe (dry basis) in Quebec in 2011. The concentrate is produced at 4% humidity. ;Specific data were collected for one compagny which represents nearly 65% of the Québec's production for the year 2011. ;The iron ore is extracted in two open pit mine; the main pit, where 92% of the ore is extracted, is located on the same site as the concentrator and the extra pit, used only when needed, is located 60 km from the concentrator. The ore is then transported by train.;65% of the 2011 production have been used in the production of iron pellet in Québec, the rest has been sold to other part of Canada, United States, Europe and China.

From the extraction of iron ore. 

This activity ends at the gate of the beneficiation plant.

The dataset includes : 
1- Extraction of the iron ore in a open pit mine. The site includes a main pit and extra pit used when needed. 
2- Crushing and concentration of the ore. The crushing is done with gyratory crushers and the concentration is realized by separating the silica and the iron by gravity.
3- Waste rocks piles
4- Taillings site and polishing pond (main pit only) 
5- Wastewater treatment 
6- Tranport of the ore extracted in the extra pit to the concentrator 

Note that the solid waste produce on site are buried in the waste rock piles (7.51E-7 m³/kg : 33% domestic waste, 31% wood, 13% cardboard, 3% metals not contaminated with oil, 9% glass/textiles/plastics and 10% construction and demolition waste).  


The dataset doesn't include : 
1- the wastewater chemicals
2- Some of the waste because of a lack of information and because the end of life of these waste didn't exist in ecoinvent when this data was created. Note that the quantities of these waste have a very low importance.
     a) Landfill : sediment sludge or oil settling (1.938E-5 kg/kg), activated carbon (4.309E-8 kg/kg), Labpack HW (water reactive) (2.789E-10 kg/kg), sodium carbonate (7.286E-8 kg/kg), contaminated equipment (2.317E-6 kg/kg), contaminated absorbent (4.28E-5 kg/kg)
     b) Recycling : used oil filters (6.095E-6 kg/kg), antifreeze/brake and hydraulic fluid (4.003E-6 kg/kg), lead batteries (1.206E-6 k/kg), activated glass (4.557E-7 kg/kg), batteries/other accumulators (2.45E-7 kg/kg), sikagrout and waste contaminated to mercury (6.251E-7 kg/kg), contaminated containers (4.652E-7 kg/kg), Aerosol cans/lubricant/paint (4.415E-7 kg/kg), empty barrels contaminated with sulfuric acid (1.883E-8 kg/kg) and empty barrels contaminated with toluene (2.101E-7 kg/kg)
    c) Physico-chemical treatement : oily water/emulsions (3.775E-6 kg/kg), laboratory acid and base (4.846E-8 kg/kg)
    d) Lack of information on the product (not able to add the input) : laboratory product sent to incineration (7.6E-8E-8 kg/kg), flammable solid sent to incineration (5.564E-7 kg/kg)
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/071:Mining of iron ores/0710:Mining of iron ores

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Collected data for Quebec industry for the year 2011
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data relate to the Quebec average
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Milling and mechanical sorting. Average iron yield is 75%. ;Specific data were collected on one of the two production site in Quebec. According to the documentation available, the technologies of the 2 mines seems similar. Uncertainity has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Extrapolations were made from the GLO dataset for some water emissions (DOC, BOD5, TOC, COD and cyanide) and for the mine infrastructure and recultivation. 
Specific data were collected on one of the two production site in Quebec. According to the documentation available, the technologies of the 2 mines seems similar. Uncertainity has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Specific data were collected on one of the two production site in Quebec.

exchanges.description:
Measured Value. Reference product given on a dry basis but produce at 4% humidity.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

exchanges.description:
Measured Value given by data provider (source : questionnaire). Emissions related to explosive (Anfor) for the main pit and extra pit.

The combustion of waste oil on site is also generating carbon monoxide. The estimation based on the amount of waste oil burned on site (4.4644E-5 kg/kg) and the dataset treatment of waste mineral oil, hazardous waste incineration GLO (ecoinvent v3) is very small in comparaison to the above mentionned measured value (5.608E-10 kg/kg).
